headline.main: Thomas J. Watson Sr. Is Dead; I.B.M. Board Chairman Was 82; 'World's Greatest Salesman' Built 629 Million Company --Coined 'THINK' Slogan Thomas J. Watson Sr. Is Dead; I.B.M. Board Chairman Was 82 Optimistic in Outlook Slogan Always in Sight Industrial 'Family' Concept Was Friend of Presidents President Pays Tribute

snippet: Thomas J. Watson Sr., who built the fabulous International Business Machines Corporation, died of a heart attack yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 82 years old and had been hospitalized since Sunday.
